# Question

Write a function `timezone_bumper(dt,bump)` that increases any provided timestamp by `bump::Int` hours (defaults to +3 hours). Make sure it works only for DateTime types and throws an error for Date types.

```julia
function timezone_bumper(dt::DateTime, bump::Integer = 3)
    if typeof(dt) == Date
        throw(DomainError("Cannot bump time zone of a Date; use DateTime type instead."))
    end
    return dt + Dates.Hour(bump)
end
```

This function `timezone_bumper` takes a `DateTime` object and an optional integer `bump` specifying the number of hours to add. If `bump` is not provided, it defaults to adding 3 hours. The function checks if the input is a `Date` type and throws an error if so, as Date objects do not have time zone information and cannot be bumped in time zone.
